grossHint421: WELSH NEEDED Gross value of assets for probate in £
grossHintNoIHT:
WELSH NEEDED Gross value in £

This is the total value of the deceased’s assets in their sole name
To work this out, subtract the values of any joint assets passing to the other joint owner, foreign assets, all gifts and assets held in trust from the gross value of IHT. (link to HMRC’s definition of gifts)
netHint207: WELSH NEEDED Net value of the estate for probate in the UK in £
netHint421: WELSH NEEDED Net value of the estate for probate in £
netHintNoIHT:
WELSH NEEDED Net value in £

Take away any debts in the deceased’s sole name from the gross value

To work this out, take the gross value for probate and deduct the total value of the deceased’s debts including funeral expenses and any other debts they owe at the time of their death in their sole name.
